rules: Rule1: Should the restaurant have a permit, then it does not serve food.
Rule2: In the event that the inspector checks the stall, then if it is not the case that lacking a valid license implies authorization would lead to a warning, the vendor gets a penalty.
Rule3: Either the inspector checks the stall or the manager reviews the stall.
Rule4: Should the manager review the stall, then if it is not the case that lacking a license implies authorization would result in a warning, the vendor gets a penalty.
Rule5: Whenever the vendor operates legally, then the vendor is authorized.
Rule6: Under the condition that the vendor pays fees, the vendor operates legally.
Rule7: Either the vendor pays fees or the vendor has an exemption.
Rule8: Either the customer has a complaint or, if the vendor has an exemption, the vendor operates legally.
Rule9: The customer makes a report or the customer does not have a complaint.
Rule10: The customer submits feedback or the customer does not make a report.
Rule11: Either the item is food available or the vendor is authorized.
Rule12: When a promotion runs for the event, then either there is a special offer for the item or, provided that the item is food available, it can be ordered.
Rule13: Either a promotion runs for the event or the event has a seasonal sale.
Rule14: Under the condition that the event has a seasonal sale, then either there is a special offer for the item or, if the item is food available, it can be ordered.
Rule15: Either a violation is found at the restaurant or there is a compliance issue at the restaurant.
Rule16: Provided that there is a compliance issue at the restaurant, then the restaurant does not have a permit.
Rule17: Should an audit be conducted at the restaurant, then if a violation is found, the restaurant does not have a permit.
Rule18: Either an audit is conducted at the restaurant or an inspection is done at the restaurant.
Rule19: If the restaurant applies for a permit, then, provided that it has a permit, it serves food.
Rule20: In the event that a fine is issued to the vendor, then a warning is issued to the vendor.

Rule21: Under the condition that enforcement action is taken against the vendor, then if it is not the case that inspection done implies violation found leads to no permit, a fine is issued to the vendor.
Rule22: Either the customer's complaint is resolved or the customer does not make a report.
Rule23: Should the customer receive a refund, then the customer's complaint is not resolved.
Rule24: Provided that the customer gets compensation, then the customer is satisfied.
Rule25: In the event that the manager intervenes in the issue, then if the customer receives an apology, the customer gets compensation.
Rule26: Either the manager intervenes in the issue or the owner resolves the issue.
Rule27: Under the condition that the restaurant renews its permit, then, should it have a permit, it serves food.
Rule28: Should the owner resolve the issue, then if the customer receives an apology, the customer gets compensation.
Rule29: When a discount is available for the item, then either there is a special offer for the item or, provided that the item is food available, it can be ordered.
Rule30: If the price is reduced for the item, then the item is not at full price.
Rule31: Either the price is reduced for the item or the item is on clearance sale.
Rule32: Provided that the item is on clearance sale, then the item is not at full price.
Rule33: Should the restaurant submit an application, then the restaurant applies for a permit.
Rule34: In the event that the restaurant files a renewal, then the restaurant renews its permit.
Rule35: Under the condition that the restaurant completes forms, then the restaurant submits an application.
Rule36: Whenever the restaurant updates documents, then the restaurant files a renewal.
Rule37: Should the restaurant initiate a process, then either it completes forms or it updates documents.
Rule38: Should it not be the case that lacking a refund implies no voucher, then the customer receives an apology.
Rule39: In the event that it is not the case that not receiving a refund implies not getting a voucher, then the customer is not satisfied.
Rule40: If the customer does not receive a refund, then the customer gets a voucher.
Rule41: Whenever a discount is not available for the item, then the item is at full price.
Rule42: Provided that the vendor is not authorized, then the restaurant has a permit.
facts: Fact1: The vendor has a license.
Fact2: An enforcement action is taken against the vendor.
Fact3: The restaurant initiates a process.
Fact4: The vendor does not get a warning.
Fact5: The vendor does not get a penalty.
Fact6: The customer does not submit feedback.
Fact7: The item cannot be ordered.
Fact8: There is no special offer for the item.
Fact9: A warning is not issued to the vendor.
